reviews.text: I am not the greatest of campers - best saying this from the offset ! And I heard it was going to be a bit windy.
reviews.title: Great views a bit short of services

reviews.text: We arrived about 6.30 and the shop was open, theres not much in it, paid our bond of £20 each in CASH I was not aware of that, thank goodness I had it on me. We were given the list of rules and the information leaflet and told we could camp anywhere. Naturaly I drove around for 20 min (maybe more) to choose just the right spot ! Much to the amusement of the other campers.
reviews.title: Rules Rules and more rules

reviews.text: Found a great spot on a flat, you do need to look around it is quite hilly. Started to set up and wait for our friends. They arrived about an hour later only to find the shop shut so they could not get any food :( Thank goodness they found us, what do people do when they arrive, I would be scared to pitch any where incase I got told to move the next day ..
reviews.title: Great if you like it quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The toilet and shower block at that end is pretty grim and cold and to make matters worse the lights were not working which made it creepy in the dark and wind with the plastic flap things. That said, the water was hot, there was toilet roll, soap and paper towels so no complants about that. I reported that the lights were not working and someone came out fairly promptly, they could not be repaired so they put a candle in ... .
reviews.title: great site

reviews.text: The site was really quiet which really suited me, so only the wind and weird tent noises to keep me awake. The middle of the night trip to the loo was cold and creepy. And a draughty shower was not great in the morning.
reviews.title: Lovely location, ruined by rude staff and long list of rules

reviews.text: I have just come back from a 3 day bank holiday weekend and was really pleased with the site. We arrived late on Friday approx 7.30pm as we live 3 hour drive away, had no problem signing in. We were 3 family groups together so there was a £20 each family bond to put down which we easily got back at the end of our trip. Yes there is a long list of rules, but what campsite doesnt have rules? The kids played in the park most of the day and we werent disturbed at any point of our stay by other campers or by the owners. Toilet and shower block was amazing, always clean and presentable, with spacious shower cubicles. I am an early riser so at 6-7am hot water was plentiful although there was on one occasion at 9am no hotwater for a short period. We comfortably ran many electrical items off the electric point without any tripping which was nice. Some areas of the campsite are exposed to wind as the site is so high but where we stayed (140,141 and 142) was well sheilded by the trees and was actually a lovely corner plot for the 3 families to live, play and enjoy!
reviews.title: Very lovely

reviews.text: The shop has periods of closure, but we just made sure we knew these... simple! And as for the grumpy staff... didnt see any?! The lady in the shop was lovely, friendly and chatty.
reviews.title: Sea Barn Farm Camping

reviews.text: We only ventured to the other site once for chips on the first night as we were hungry and it was late, seemed busier and club house seemed ok but it was late so not sure what it is like during busy periods. My only grumble was the price of the food, portion of cheesy chips £3.90 each and they really werent great chips or even a large portion, I couldnt even contemplate eating anything else there after that.
reviews.title: Lovely clean site

reviews.text: 15 min drive to Weymouth beach which is just beautiful and lots to do for everyone of various ages. Perfect place for a full fish and chip supper each on the beach, for the same price as 4 cheesey chips on site! There is an Asda just on the outskirts of the town and a morrisons near as well which is perfect for picking up cheaper supplies.
reviews.title: poor site

reviews.text: Not specfic to my family as I do not have dogs, but the no dogs off leads at any point was more fustrating to the other two families who have well trained good natured dogs. Understandable with the horses and I am well aware other families are not happy with dogs but I think as a point of futher thought the campsite should consider at least one place i.e a field specifically for dogs to be allowed off the lead. Just to keep all happy!
reviews.title: Got far to greedy

reviews.text: Having just spent 8 nights at seabarn I can't fault the views quietness and the facilities are to die for. Clean constant hot water free hair dryer and showers even two bathrooms ideal for young families would definately stay here again, unlike the site we have just moved to in Eastbourne but that's another story.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.text: What a fantastic location and base for viewing the the Jurrasic Coast! Excellent pitches and facilities where very clean. We would definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Fantastic base for viewing Jurassic Coast Line

reviews.text: The reviews did mention the staff about being very unfriendly , they where spot on but this did not spoil our stay at the Sea Barn.
reviews.title: Good site and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this site!
reviews.title: Sea Barn Farm - Beautiful!

reviews.text: Having read mixed reviews of Sea Barn, we were relieved to find the facilities to be very good and location above Chesil Beach to be lovely. There were also some good little walks around the site down to the Fleet which gave some great views out to sea and towards the beach, Weymouth & Portland.
reviews.title: View to die for

reviews.text: we stayed here for one night, (booked in for 3) but our tent completely broke and we had to leave late last night, AND we forgot our barbecue!!! apologies to the lovely ladies who work there who will have to pick it up, we realised too late to come back :(
reviews.title: lovely!

reviews.text: apart from our tent being rubbish, we had a wonderful time here.
reviews.title: Great Site

reviews.text: the new block of showers and laundry area were so clean they looked like they had never been used, the shop has pretty much everything you could want to buy.
reviews.title: Superb site, had a great time, but please, management, LISTEN to all the comments about staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at about 10am on the 10th and were able to set up straight away as there were only a few other tents there.
reviews.title: Stayed from 11/06/12 - 19/06/12

reviews.text: the views are AMAZING.
reviews.title: Stunning location
